page.title: 09A STREET INTERVIEW
page.content: A group of the researchers interviewed an old gentleman whilst doing field work in Askam. Asked about his opinion of the life in the district he replied with enthusiasm: "It suits me fine. I have my allotment,I keep poultry,I keep pigeons,I love wild life,particularly birds,although there have been certain changes in the area which has altered the pattern of wild life visitors.For instance,some derelict areas have introduced pollution of the environment and as a consequence some wild life no longer visits the scene, particularly in the housing areas." Asked if he was satisfied with the services available in the district he replied: "Yes, I do not seem to require more than at present." A contented man, in fact!
